snippet: The talks, which brought President Salva Kiir and the leader of the rebellion, Riek Machar, face to face, came amid growing international pressure.
abstract: South Sudan's Pres Salva Kiir and rebel leader Riek Machar sign agreement to resolve civil war that has torn young country apart; talks bring two men together for first time since conflict erupted, and come following intense international pressure on both sides.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The talks, which brought President Salva Kiir and the leader of the rebellion, Riek Machar, face to face, came amid growing international pressure.

headline.main: Death Toll Rising, 2 Sides Sign Pact to End South Sudan War
headline.print_headline: Toll Rising, 2 Sides Sign Pact to End South Sudan War
